descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from onboarding to active participation.
The skill up flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing members from the new contributor pool.
The promotion rate flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing capable new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the core developer stock by promoting experienced contributors who demonstrate commitment.
Implicit knowledge transfer accelerates the skill up flow by providing direct mentorship and hands-on learning.
Implicit knowledge transfer increases the promotion rate by preparing contributors with the necessary skills and project understanding.
More core developers increase implicit knowledge transfer capacity by providing more mentors for the community.
Explicit knowledge transfer facilitates the skill up flow by providing accessible documentation and learning resources.
An increase in the colored stock (potential contributors) expands the pool of new contributors entering the project.
A larger new contributor stock increases the skill up flow as more individuals are actively learning and progressing.
A larger core developer stock can increase turnover due to burnout or members seeking new opportunities.
A larger experienced contributor stock increases the promotion rate by providing a larger pool of candidates ready for core roles.
